name: Shakshuka
instructions: Drizzle olive oil in a hot cast iron pan.
Add diced bell peppers to the pan.
Mortar and pestle hard-boiled eggs with salt until a paste forms.
Add the egg paste to the pan.
Once the pan smells fragrant, add tomato paste and cook for a couple of minutes.
Add paprika, chili powder, cumin, and oregano.
Add tomatoes, salt, and optional sugar.
Splash in a little water and cover the pan.
Simmer until tomatoes reach a jammy consistency.
Crack eggs into a bowl, creating a well, then gently transfer them to the pan.
Cover and cook for a few minutes until the yolks reach desired doneness.
Garnish with fresh parsley and optional cheese.
